TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit TransportHeaders extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ITransportHeaders

Docs.summary: Stores a collection of headers used in the channel sinks.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the `foreach` statement to iterate over the contents of the header list that contains objects of type <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry>. Keys to the headers are required to be strings, and comparisons are done on a case-insensitive basis.
This class makes a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level. A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have infrastructure permission. For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) and [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).

Docs.permission: for operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission Value:

MemberSignature.Value: public object this[object key] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The that the requested header is associated with.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a transport header that is associated with the given key.
Docs.value: A transport header that is associated with the given key, or if the key was not found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `key` parameter must be a <xref:System.String>.
